intro: Trichomanes schiedeanum var. brazilianum, commonly known as the Brazilian water fern, is a member of the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is a small, epiphytic fern that thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has delicate, finely divided fronds that are often covered in a layer of moisture-retaining hairs. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of many fern species. This variety is notable for its adaptability to moist, shaded habitats and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native environments.
